communities.convertInfo:
We can take care of converting your group to a community.

 This is an irreversible process and will do the following:

* freeze the existing group
* create a new community with the same name as the group
* add a public channel to the community with the same name as the group
* add all members of the group as members of the community
* copy the full message history from the group into the channe
* delete the existing group
* inform all members of the group that it has been converted to a community

This process might take a few minutes depending on the size of the group so please be patient.

faq.airdrop_a:
In April there was an airdrop of 1M CHAT tokens to eligble Diamond users. See this motion proposal for details.

Later this year the OpenChat dev team will make a proposal to implement a user rewards scheme. Diamond users will be able to earn CHAT tokens based on their reputation score within OpenChat. Exactly how reputation is calculated has not been decided but great efforts will be taken to ensure spammers are penalised. We want to encourage genuine chat and not provide an opportunity for bots or unscrupulous users to "farm" tokens.
faq.android_app_a: As for iOS (see above), the OpenChat web app does already work on Android and you can "Add to homescreen" from the browser menu. This gives you a standard icon to open the app which appears more like a native app without a url bar. Progressive Web App (PWA) support is very good on Android. Like iOS it supports web push notifications but also does support the reading of contacts from the phone (if you grant permisson in each case). Beyond that the support for WebRTC is much better. As such the case for producing a native Android app is less compelling and will come after a native iOS app. The same considerations apply to the building of an Android app as an iOS in terms of aiming for a thin native wrapper around a core web app, and with regards to certification on the Android play store.
faq.android_app_q: When will there be an Android app?
faq.buychat_a:
You can buy CHAT on various cryptocurrency exchanges:

ExchangeStyleBuy withCEX/DEX
Helix MarketsOrderbookUSDCHybrid
BitMartOrderbookUSDTCEX
BitrueOrderbookUSDTCEX
CoinstoreOrderbookUSDTCEX
LBankOrderbookUSDTCEX
ICDexOrderbookICPDEX
KongSwapSwap (AMM)USDTDEX
ICPSwapSwap (AMM)ICPDEX
SonicSwap (AMM)ICPDEX

You can also swap tokens for CHAT directly from your OpenChat wallet which will automatically use the swap exchange with the best available price.
faq.buychat_q: How do I buy CHAT tokens?
faq.buyicp_a:
1. You can buy ICP tokens on major exchanges like Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, and others. These platforms allow you to trade various cryptocurrencies for ICP.
  2. The Network Nervous System (NNS) dapp offers a feature to purchase ICP using a credit card. You'll need to log in with your Internet Identity and follow the prompts to complete the transaction Frequently Asked Questions > Internet Computer > Network Nervous System (NNS) > How do I purchase ICP from within the NNS dapp?.
  3. You can use decentralized exchanges (DEXs) on the Internet Computer to swap other cryptocurrencies for ICP. For example:
    • ICDex.io allows you to swap Bitcoin (in the form of ckBTC) for ICP.
    • ICPSwap offers trading pairs with ICP.
faq.buyicp_q: How do I buy ICP tokens?
faq.content_a: For full details of our content and moderation guidelines see here.
faq.content_q: What kind of content is permissible?
faq.diamond_a: You can upgrade to Diamond membership to have access to extra or enhanced features within OpenChat. See here for a feature comparison and to upgrade.
faq.info_a: Go to our home page and find links to OpenChat features, roadmap, whitepaper, architecture and blog
faq.info_q: Where can I find out more about OpenChat?
faq.ios_app_a: It is worth saying that the OpenChat web app does already work on iOS and you can "Add to homescreen" from the browser menu. This gives you a standard icon to open the app which appears more like a native app without a url bar. Also recently Apple has added support for web push notifications which is crucial for a messaging app if you are offline or not using the app. In general Apple's support for so-called Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) lags behind Android because PWAs threaten the dominance of the App Store. It lacks support (compared with Android PWAs) for reading phone contacts and the WebRTC implementation is buggy (needed for peer to peer voice/video calls). Because of these limitations producing a native iOS app is relatively high on our agenda. Although on the face of it OpenChat is "just a chat app" it is actually rather complicated with a significant code base. An ideal solution for us, would be to wrap the OpenChat web app in a thin native app which communicates with the native phone APIs in such a way that the large bulk of the code base remains common without compromising the native app experience. We are researching this area but it is not yet clear if this will be possible or how difficult it will be. Another potential road block is the App Store certification process. By having the core application as a web app we could make changes to an OpenChat iOS app without going through an approval process which might not be acceptable. However if these problems can be solved it is possble an iOS app could be ready in a few months. Otherwise, if we need to re-write (and then maintain) a native iOS OpenChat from scratch, then this will take significantly longer...
faq.ios_app_q: When will there be an iOS app?
faq.referral_rewards_a:
You earn CHIT rewards for each user you refer who goes on to verify their unique personhood or becomes a Diamond member. If a user you refer goes on to get Diamond membership you will earn 5,000 CHIT, if they prove unique personhood, it is 10,000 CHIT and if they get lifetime Diamond, it is 15,000 CHIT. If they subsequently do a higher value "verification" you will be awarded the difference in CHIT. You can find your referral link in the "invite friends/family" section of your "profile settings" from the main menu.

How might you do this? There are lots of ways. You can tell friends and family, tweet about OpenChat, create a video about OpenChat describing what you love about it and share it to TikTok or YouTube. You could stream on Twitch or write a blog post or create a podcast or host a Twitter space or even hold a real life meet-up. We look forward to seeing all the creative ideas that you come up with to get the word out!
faq.security_a: In short the Internet Computer provides very strong security guarentees. There is however a particular well known area of weakness which Dfinity are tackling. With some effort a rogue node provider could install a hacked version of the node software allowing them to intercept and read ingress messages and directly read memory. However, once SEV-SNP is available on node machines, users can be extremely confident that, apart from the recipients of their messages, their data will not be accessible to anyone but themselves. At a later date we will implement e2e encryption so that the data is actually stored in encrypted form in canister memory and would therefore not be accessible by rogue node operators regardless of SEV-SNP being in place. This will likely involve some limitations, such as not being able to search your message history, so you could choose to opt-in to e2e security for selected chats.
faq.send_tokens_a:
When sending tokens as a chat message, the transfer is performed by the ledger for the given token which incurs a mandatory fee. This fee is burned, slightly reducing the token supply. The fees for the various tokens we support are as follows:
  • CHAT 0.001
  • ICP 0.0001
  • ckBTC 0.0000001
  • SNS1 0.00001
faq.send_tokens_q: Why am I charged a transaction fee when sending tokens?
faq.shortcuts_a:
There are several shortcut commands that you can use from the message entry input box.

`/poll` - to create a new poll
`/search xyz` - to search the current chat for the term "xyz"
`/gif kittens` - to search for kitten gifs
`/icp 0.1` - to send 0.1 ICP to someone
`/faq question_id*` - to create and post a formatted link to a specific FAQ question
`/diamond` - to create and post a formatted link with the details of Diamond membership

Commands which accept an argument can also be used without the argument.

* Available faq question IDs are: airdrop, voting, wallet, buychat, send_tokens, diamond, ios_app, android_app, find_groups, style_messages, storage, security, roadmap, shortcuts
faq.storage_a:
Text messages take little space and so cost us relatively little. Images typically take much more space and the costs add up. Now some background on the OpenChat system. Each user has their own canister which holds all the messages for their direct chats. Each group also has its own canister which holds all the group messages. However, we store any file data associated with messages, such as images and video, in OpenStorage. Each user has a data rolling allowance and when a message is sent any file data comes out of the sender's allowance. This also applies to messages sent to groups so there is no group data allowance just an individual one.

Each OpenChat user will receive 0.1GB of free storage. A user can then optionally upgrade to Diamond to receive 1GB of storage. When a user reaches their storage limit, their oldest files will automatically expire and be reclaimed. This means that a user should never run out of storage. To minimise our costs, free tier user’s files will also be reclaimed after ninety days regardless of their storage usage. Note that the message itself, including any caption and an image thumbnail, would never be deleted and so the message history would be maintained.
faq.style_messages_a: You can add line breaks by using shift-enter and we also support most aspects of markdown. Follow this link for a good summary of markdown syntax.
faq.translation_a: Our translations are provided by Google translate by default and sometimes there is just not enough context for Google to do a good job. It often takes a native language speaker to provide a better translation. If you have selected one of our non-english supported languages in your profile, you will notice that there is also a toggle in your profile to activate translation correction mode. With this mode enabled, you will see a small translate icon next to each label within the UI that has been translated. If you click this icon you will then be able to submit a suggested correction. Try to come up with a suggestion that is both accurate and fits well into the UI. You can check how your suggestion looks in place and repeat the procedure as many times as you like. Your suggestion will be reviewed by the team and will be adopted if approved. You will be rewarded in CHAT for each approved correction you provide. We really appreciate you taking the time to make our translations better - we couldn't do it without you.
faq.translation_q: How can I correct a translation error?
faq.voting_a: Join the OpenChat proposals group and read this blog post which gives an overview of OpenChat governance and has a step-by-step guide on voting.
faq.voting_q: How do I vote on proposals?
faq.wallet_a: When an OpenChat user is created, they automatically have an account for a bunch of tokens (ICP, CHAT, ckBTC, SNS1). This account will initially be empty but you can top up the account by transfering tokens to its address. Once you have some tokens in your OpenChat wallet you will be able to send them directly to the account of any other OpenChat user via a special kind of message. You can also use the ICP (soon CHAT) in your wallet to upgrade to Diamond membership. If you would like to send the tokens to another account you can do so by opening your wallet from the main menu and clicking the "send" link. This screen gives you the option to send your tokens to any other address of your choosing.

p2pSwap.confirmSend: When you create this offer {amount} {token} (includes 2 transaction fees) will be transferred from your wallet to the OpenChat Escrow canister. It will stay there until either the offer expires, you cancel the offer, or the offer is accepted. Do you wish to proceed?
p2pSwap.creatingYourMessage: Please wait while a swap offer is created
p2pSwap.failedToCreateMessage: Failed to create the swap offer
p2pSwap.insufficient_funds: You have insufficient funds remaining to accept this swap offer
p2pSwap.insufficientBalanceMessage: You need at least {amount} {token} (includes 2 transaction fees) to accept this swap.
p2pSwap.reservedBy: This offer has been reserved by {user} and is pending completion.
p2pSwap.summary: This is an offer to swap {fromAmount} {fromToken} for {toAmount} {toToken}.
p2pSwap.swap_cancelled: This swap offer has been cancelled
p2pSwap.swap_not_found: This swap offer could not be found
p2pSwap.youAccepted: You have accepted this offer and it is pending completion.
p2pSwap.youReserved: You have reserved this offer and it is pending completion.

proposal.noEligibleNeuronsMessage:
No eligible or linked neurons found. In order to vote on proposals from within OpenChat you must first add your OpenChat user id as a hotkey to any neurons you wish to vote with.

Your OpenChat user id is: {userId}.

For more information on voting and governance read this blog post.

report.advice: If you believe this message violates the rules of this group, please contact the owners and admins on the group in the first instance. Only report a message for platform moderation if you feel like it violates the [platform rules]({rules}) otherwise it wastes moderators time. Persistent mis-reporting could lead to your own account being suspended.
report.failure: Sorry we were unable to report this message to the platform moderators
report.messageReport: Reported by @{username} on {timestamp} for the following reason: **{reason}**
report.notePlaceholder: Tell us why you are reporting this content
report.showing: Showing the most recent {count} of {total} report(s)
report.success: The message has been reported to the platform moderators
report.title: Report message

reportBug: If you think this is a bug, click here to report the full details

restricted.generic: In order to comply with local laws, this feature is not permitted in your current jurisdiction
restricted.swap: In order to comply with local laws, tokens swaps are not permitted in your current jurisdiction.

restrictedContentInfo: Choose whether you would like to see groups and communities that have had the following moderation flags applied.

rules.channelRulesExplanation: these will be prefixed to any community rules

rules.instructions: If enabled, new members must agree to the rules before they can send messages.
rules.promptExistingUsersInstructions: Existing members must agree to the new rules before they can send messages.

selectAChannel: Select a channel from the list or search for more channels in this community.

sendMessageDisabledAnon: Please sign-in to send a message

stats.reportedMessagesInfo: Messages sent by you that were deleted or reported by others. This may be used as an indication that you are not contributing positively to the community.

switchDomain.blurb:
You are currently using the [{currentDomain}]({currentDomain}) domain.

You will not receive notifications from this legacy domain and it will soon be retired altogether.

*To continue using OpenChat and benefit fully from ongoing performance optimisations please switch to our new domain [https://oc.app](https://oc.app)*

If you have saved the site to your home screen you will need to delete/uninstall and save to home screen again from the new domain.
switchDomain.title: Please switch to our new domain

tapForReferralLink: Tap to copy your personal referral link
tapToLogin: Guest mode - tap here to sign in
thisIsPrivateGroupWithN: This is a private {level} with {number} members
thisIsPublicGroupWithN: This is a public {level} with {number} members

tip.advice: Tap as many times as you like to leave a tip

tip.noExchangeRate: We have no exchange rate configured for {token}

tokenSwap.bestQuote: The best exchange rate quoted is {rate} {tokenOut} per {tokenIn} from {dex}.
tokenSwap.confirmUnderstanding: Check this box to confirm you understand
tokenSwap.noQuotes: No DEXes provided a quote to swap {tokenIn}
tokenSwap.proceedWithSwap: The swap will only go ahead if the amount of {tokenOut} to be received is at least 98% of the amount quoted. Would you like to go ahead and attempt the swap?

progress.error: Swap error - no funds have been lost
progress.failed: Swap failed - the exchange rate has changed

tokenSwap.quoteTooLow: The best rate quoted is {rate} {tokenOut} per {tokenIn} from {dex}. This gives {amountOut} {tokenOut} for {amountIn} {tokenIn}. You can only swap if the quoted amount out exceeds {minAmountOut}.
tokenSwap.swapNotAvailable: Currently it is not possible to swap {tokenIn} to any other token
tokenSwap.warningValueDropped: Due to low liquidity, the value of {tokenOut} you will receive is < 90% of the value of {tokenIn} you will swap (based on the quoted USD value of these tokens).
tokenSwap.warningValueUnknown: The current dollar price for one of more of these tokens is not available so it is not possible to determine whether this swap represents good value.

upgrade.airdropsInfo: Diamond users will be automatically eligible for any airdrops or giveaways!
upgrade.cannotExtend: You can only extend your membership within three months of expiry
upgrade.congratulations: You can now enjoy our Diamond features!
upgrade.diamondStorageLimit: 1GB of free storage after which the oldest files will be automatically deleted. Data within storage limits never expires.
upgrade.freeStorageLimit: 100MB of free storage after which the oldest files will be automatically deleted. Files expire after 90 days.
upgrade.gatingMsg: To create groups with gated access, you must be a Diamond user
upgrade.groupMsg: To create up to 10 public groups and to control group access, you must be a Diamond user
upgrade.insufficientFunds: Please ensure that your {token} account contains at least {amount}
upgrade.mediaLimits: Images, files and audio clips are limited to {image}, videos are limited to {video}
upgrade.paymentSmallprint: If you opt to automatically renew your payment, you must ensure that you have sufficient funds in your OpenChat ICP account. The OpenChat bot will send you a friendly reminder. If you choose not to auto-renew or we cannot take the appropriate payment, you will revert to the free plan immediately and you may lose files or media you have posted.
upgrade.upgradeSuccess: Your payment has been made successfully

userReferralMessage: Share this link to OpenChat with friends and family. You earn CHIT rewards for each user you refer who goes on to verify their unique personhood or becomes a Diamond member. If a user you refer goes on to get Diamond membership you will earn 5,000 CHIT, if they prove unique personhood, it is 10,000 CHIT and if they get lifetime Diamond, it is 15,000 CHIT. If they subsequently do a higher value "verification" you will be awarded the difference in CHIT.
userSearchFailed: There was an error searching for users
